intro: Beilschmiedia riparia, commonly known as the river beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with lance-shaped leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by oval-shaped berries that are typically dark purple when mature. Beilschmiedia riparia is often found growing near water sources, which contributes to its common name.
